title: Xiaomi Redmi 8 Budget Phone Launched: Here’s Everything You Need To Know!
text:
Xiaomi is known to make some really cool and affordable smartphones, and it has launched the Redmi 8 that is targetted for people looking to get a feature-packed phone under Rs 10,000.

Here's everything you need to know about the Redmi 8 smartphone.

Xiaomi

Redmi 8 Display

Xiaomi's Redmi 8 features a 6.26-inch LCD panel with a resolution of 1520x720 pixels. The display gets a teardrop notch on top and a thick chin at the bottom, which also holds the Redmi branding. The display gets the oleophobic coating for water and dust protection.

Redmi 8 Design

Xiaomi is bringing a new 'Aura Mirror' design language with minimal aesthetics at the back. Also at the back is a fingerprint scanner. While the Onyx Black colour option looks matte and minimal, the device is also available in gradient Saphire Blue and Ruby Red, with effects similar to the ones seen on the Xiaomi Mi A3.

Xiaomi

Redmi 8 Camera

Coming to the shooters on the Redmi 8, at the back you get a dual-camera setup with a 12-megapixel f/1.8 shooter and a secondary 2-megapixel depth sensor. It can shoot full-HD videos at 30fps. For selfies, the phone gets an 8-megapixel f/2.0 shooter.

Redmi 8 Performance

Under the hood, Xiaomi Redmi 8 is rocking Qualcomm's Snapdragon 439 octa-core, paired with Adreno 505 GPU. The device comes in 3GB/32GB and 4GB/64GB storage variants. The device is running on MIUI 9 based on Android 9.0 Pie. Powering the phone is a ginormous 5000mAh with support for 18W fast charging using USB Type-C.

Xiaomi

Redmi 8 Pricing And Availability

As mentioned earlier. Xiaomi Redmi 8 is available in two variants. The 3GB/32GB variant of the Redmi 8 is priced at Rs 7,999, whereas the 4GB/64GB variant is priced at Rs 8,999. The device is expected to hit the shelves starting October 12th and will be available for purchase on Flipkart, Mi.com as well as offline Mi stores across the country.
